website_summaries.verdict: These are shorter cables, but you're receiving an excellent price with two cables in the set.
pros: These short cables are easy to install, as you won't have to worry about having extra cable getting in the way
Delivers two cables for a low price
Gives you the super speed data transfers that you expect
cons: Shorter than average with at 3 feet, so you're limited as to where you can use them

customer_reviews.title: Bad connection when plugged in as designed.
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into my USB charger and it wouldn't charge my phone. So I thought it was the power brick or maybe the micro USB cable. After trying different things, it turned out that if you plug this all the way into any USB port, it doesn't make a good connection. You need to have it pulled out just a little bit... but at this point, it doesn't click into the slots, so it comes out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Not good for web cams
customer_reviews.text: With so many positive reviews, I am dissapointed mine dont work properly. I was really hoping I could extend my Logitech Web cam away from the computer and into another room...but I get no video using these extensions. The screen ends up black, no matter the arrangement or if only using one of the two. BUT other extensions i have bought work. These Amazon cables aren't dead; there is a connection to these. But without the video, for my purposes, these are useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The cable works fine. But the fittings were not flush
customer_reviews.text: The cable works fine. But the fittings were not flush. Thinking my product was defective, I ordered a replacement, but the usb female end on the replacement product on this one was also not deep enough to fully plug in any male usb cord I own. See photo. Don't know if this matters, but only time I have seen that ever re: usb devices.
customer_reviews.author: Love Good Products!

customer_reviews.title: Buy this, not 'cablematters'
customer_reviews.text: this actually works as a usb extension for my usb wifi adapter. At first I thought it was the drivers, then I decided to get a new wifi adapter and new extension cable because I had some suspicions with this company called 'cable matters'. Lo and behold my suspicions were correct, I got screwed with a cheap low quality usb extension cable from 'cable matters'. With that extension cable, my wifi would disconnect every time I tried to download anything. With this new amazonbasics cable, I can download all day to my hearts content without a single hiccup!! The funny thing is that this amazonbasics cable is about half the price of 'cablematters'. Go figure, cheaper is better here haha.
customer_reviews.author: Tiny D

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge over .55 amps
customer_reviews.text: Will not charge over .55amps to my phone. Thought it would being 3.0. I thought this would support fast charging. Maybe that only refers to data speed and that's my fault for not understanding. It feels robust and like it will last for ever. But when put thru an ammeter, it will not go above .55 amps. I put only my factory cord on my phone and the ammeter reads 1.16 amps. So this limits the power.
customer_reviews.author: review-er-er

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extending my Wi-Fi antenna.
customer_reviews.text: I used this to extend the antenna of my Wifi card out from behind the desk. It’s long enough to move the antenna around my desk and mount in the side of the monitor. My Wi-Fi improved by 40% to 96%. Saved me a ton of hassle and money cause I was looking at range extenders and all kinds of gadgets to get better reception.
customer_reviews.author: Madtown

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable Connection on Male Plug
customer_reviews.text: The male end has an unreliable connection. When plugged in all the way, it does not make a reliable connection. If you pull it out just a touch and hold it there, the connection is reliable - while you are holding it. I plugged these into a computer, a USB hub, and two different AC charging plugs - the same behavior was exhibited with every device. Both of the cables exhibit the same problem. I am disappointed, as I have purchased other Amazon Basics items with good results. I will be returning these cables. Purchased April 2019.
customer_reviews.author: outgolfn

customer_reviews.title: Ruggedly made
customer_reviews.text: Ruggedly made, so much so that they are a little stiff but they work perfectly as an extension cables for my webcam and my external HDD. Just plugged them into available 3.0 USB Ports and then plugged the camera and HDD into them. Everything worked perfectly. I kind of liked the ruggedness of the cables because some 18"s of them are actually lying on the floor behind the computer (a PC) where it/theyget moved around quite often. Plugs fit tightly and look very well made. All-in-all I'm very happy with the cable(s). I'm a computer geek and am always happy with well-made peripherals. These cables fill that bill.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Brown

customer_reviews.title: one works, one doesn't - 100% waste of time,
customer_reviews.text: One of them has a problem, like a loose headphone jack it only works if you hold in just the right position. Luckily it was a two pack and I only needed one. Bummer part is that I couldn't return just one and I really needed the other one so I couldn't return both. So I feel the dealing was less than honorable by said provider.. Would not buy or recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. As others have mentioned in reviews, the female USB end does not fully fit into the USB male end of whatever you're attaching it to. Also this USB extender cord does not supply power at all. I bought it to add extra length to a pc gamepad controller and the controller couldn't receive power. I went to WalMart and bought a 10 foot USB extender for less than $5 and it works perfectly. If I could have given it zero stars I would have.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These things are great! I have always bought my cables off of Newegg, and after finding AmazonBasics, will now be buying them from here. Oh my god, I have found so many deals way better than my old vendor. The cables are of better quality also. These two USB cable extenders that I bought are of high quality and will hopefully withstand the abuse given to them laying on the floor between my Corsair Gaming setup from across the bedroom, and my gaming PC (Strafe RGB and M65-RGB). They seem to outperform the Bytech USB 3.0 extenders that they replaced very well. Never lose connection. I mean NEVER! Would buy again, and have, with several other kinds of cables...
customer_reviews.author: UnRuh3

customer_reviews.title: Terrible for devices.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Flexidesk that adjusts height, so I needed longer USB cables for my two devices, a Blue Yeti USB mic and a Logitech Brio 4k webcam. When I plugged my devices into their own extension cable, they performed terribly. The microphone was garbled and robotic, while the webcam was choppy and full of static. I couldn't figure out what the deal was until I plugged the devices into the computer directly, no extension....they worked 100% fine. I suppose these cables are good for something? But they damn sure are no good for anything I plug into them.
customer_reviews.author: Gridsquare

customer_reviews.title: Its a USB-2 not USB-3
customer_reviews.text: This cable is a FAKE and labeled incorrectly... you get what you pay for. I was testing all my cables with "ATTO Disk Benchmark" for my new computer with USB-3.0 & USB-C ports. Imagine my surprise when this cable tested at only USB-2 speeds of about 43MBs instead of about 450MBs. Cable is labeled as Premium USB 3.0 Superspeed Data Transfer, but only tests as USB-2 speed. I'm too late for a refund. Next time I will NOT be swayed by "Amazon Basics" rating. Shame on you Amazon...!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Nauman

customer_reviews.title: Female end does not fully connect with male end
customer_reviews.text: As other 1 star reviews indicate, there is a problem making a good connection of this cable with another cable or device. This has nothing to do with usb 2.0 vs usb 3.0. It is strictly a matter of mechanics, and the problem is mainly the female connector. A male connector cannot fully engage with it, so you either get a loose junction, or worse an incomplete circuit. Even the male connector of the cord can't engage with the female connector on the other end of the same cable. Useless. Oh, I suppose if you want to get out a roll of duct tape...
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy little gem. It gives me the extra length I need so I don't have to crawl under furniture to un-/plug devices to charge them. Most of them come with short cords that can't reach the wall outlet, and I don't like placing my phone or other devices on the floor for prolonged periods of time. This reaches from wall the to the desk. From their I can use the device cables and switch them out easily. I love that I don't need to fuss with the power bricks from each item. I have even added a 3-in-one splitter so I can charge or power my scanner, phone, and Kindle all at once.
customer_reviews.author: Essiejay

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this cable today 3/14/2020 to extend my cable for my new Samsung tablet. The second i plugged it in it popped up slow charging for faster charge use the cable made for your tablet. I watched for an hour later and only charged 10%, thats 10 hours for a full charge from dead. My cable that came with my tablet chargers my tablet from dead to a full charge in just 2-3 hours. I will not support this cable, especially now that it says 10× faster ? I disagree. Don't waste your money like i did. I may get around to posting picture's or video later.
customer_reviews.author: darren blocker sr

customer_reviews.title: Great value, super fast shipping, extensions works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I got this to basically extend the reception of my Plantronics wireless USB headset that I use for work. Since the USB dongle that my headset uses is essentially an antenna, it doesn’t do too well plugged directly into the back of my workstation... I can’t walk more than 20ft away without losing reception. This extension cable to raises the dongle 3ft higher and now I can even walk into the next room and still maintain a full signal. An added benefit is that I can now see the red or blue LED indicator on the dongle to let me know if my microphone is muted or not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a quite long (9.8 ft) extension cord. I am very satisfied with it. - I have used it to connect my laptop to an additional screen, and it worked flawlessly. - The color (black) makes it unobtrusive. - At $7.76, it was quite affordable. Not much else to say, really. Finally, a modest plea. If you found this review helpful, please click on the helpful button. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: i have a 2 computer set up, right next to each other. My partner uses the main dual screen, and I use mine with the 55" tv. Needless to say, it's about a solid 7 feet to get the wired keyboard to the coffe table so I can sit and use it. This ks about 9 feet long. I would have tried a wireless keyboard first, but because I use it as a gaming setup, I don't want to risk desync in the middle of a pvp or boss battle. I prefer wired keyboards and a wireless gaming mouse. This makes it a breeze to relax and use whilst I slay creatures on Runescape and WoW.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Never worked
customer_reviews.text: This never worked at all. First time I was ever sent a bad cable in my life. Nothing connected to it works. I actually have another cable i was purchasing this one to replace, and i have tried interchanging them with my devices and confirmed that this one just doesnt work. Boo. I have ordered other amazon basics cables and they worked. This might be a one time fluke, but i have to give it 1 star because this one doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well for me...freezes during file transfers with USB 3.0 port
customer_reviews.text: File transfers to and from a USB 3.0 device freezes when connected to my PCs rear USB 3.0 port. If it makes a difference, my computer's USB 3.0 controller is from Etron. #edit: tried on another computer with a native AMD USB 3.1 type A port and it also drops out there as well with many devices, including phones, hubs, monitor firmware upgrades. Only device that seemed to work was a USB flash drive, which significantly limits the usefulness of this extension cable. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Ray W.

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality USB Extension Cable
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my USB 2.0 extension cable. I recently got a 3.0 USB HUB to connect a bunch of musical gear. I used this cable to allow me to have everything on the side of the desk that is convenient for me.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Solid and serviceable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend the USB cable for the webcam I use with my desktop — with a huge monitor and some distance between the top of the monitor and the nearest available USB port. It’s heavy duty, seems to have no effect on the image and sound, and is built to last. It’s long enough that if I want to show something on the webcam I can now hand-carry the webcam to the object I want to show rather than trying to juggle the object in front of the webcam. Good solid connections at both ends. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Logitech C920
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to extend my cam and found little reviews on what to use or what worked, so thought to try this and thankfully it works. Thought to share incase others are looking for the same.
customer_reviews.author: PhotoDreamer

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money.
customer_reviews.text: The cables are thick and I've tested each cable individually on separate platforms (XBOX ONE S, Laptop and PC). The data transfers are all good and I didn't notice any drop in speed. Great value for money. I really don't understand why some people were claiming these cables were thin and data transfers were slow. You HAVE TO MAKE SURE that you've selected the USB 3.0 cables and ENSURE that you plug in the cable to an USB 3.0 port. There's no point in complaining about slow speeds if you're plugging in an USB 3.0 device to an USB 2.0 OR USB 1.1 port.
customer_reviews.author: Brian19869

customer_reviews.title: Simple Solution For Nighttime Reading
customer_reviews.text: I needed a USB extender cord in order to power a hand held reading light. This cord did the trick. Its built sturdy and USB ports fit well. One problem encounter was if I plugged it in , in a multi port USB extender it would sometimes cause the computer to freeze up. I moved the plug to a direct USB port and so far no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Joe B.

customer_reviews.title: Works Well. Holds Mating Connector firmly
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected or as well as I could tell compared or when replacing another but only 6' USB 3.0 cable. The female end holds the plug with good friction fit and it will not come out on its own. One annoying feature is that the Amazon logo side of the female connector is on the opposite site of what is normally up on a USB plug. The USB icon is always on upside of the cable but Amazon got it backwards. The cable jacket is supple and smooth making it easy to dress in a bundle of other cables.
customer_reviews.author: rkruz

customer_reviews.title: Thick 6mm diameter USB 3.0 Extension Cables - when you need these, these are the ones you want to have
customer_reviews.text: I needed these AmazonBasics USB 3.0 Extension Cable set (2) for a new Blu-Ray burner I was planning to use. The player was equipped with a 12-inch cable that was more an adapter than a cable, so I attached this extension cable to my computer so the burner could sit safely on my desk. My first impression was it is solidly built. At 6mm (diameter) thick it might be the fattest cable on the desk. This leads me to believe the voltage drop will be minimal and I'm hoping these last longer than the computer I use them with. My experience with AmazonBasics has been excellent and these cables continue to impress.
customer_reviews.author: Zzyzx Oh

customer_reviews.title: It's Premium! not Basic
customer_reviews.text: The cable is very sturdy. I want to say it's actually borderline heavy duty. Considering the price, it's a bargain. I actually use this cable to extend the power cable of my motion sensor light. I have grown tired of charging my motion sensor light battery every other night. My motion sensor light battery is usb rechargeable. I just simply connect the wall outlet to the usb rechargeable with this usb cable extension. The motion sensor light battery is now always charged. In summary, this usb cable extension is cable of delivering at least 1 amp of power. I haven't tested it for the data transfer yet.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Addict

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with USB 2.0 mouse
customer_reviews.text: The cable is high quality and works fine with my USB 3.0 devices but it does not work with USB 2.0 mouse despite claiming to be backwards compatible with USB 2.0. I don't know who is at fault here, the mouse (Amazon Basics Mouse), the cable, or another component. I did order the 2.0 version of this cable () which worked fine with my mouse, go figure. I knocked 1 star off my otherwise 5 star rating for the cable because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Sky

customer_reviews.title: Works for power, Will not connect USB devices.
customer_reviews.text: My setup is fairly benign, 4 port powered hub under my desk running a few external hard drives, hence the powered hub. Hub and Hard drives work great but the hub has a 4 inch built in cable. (Sabrent switch hub) Enter these POS Cables. Both work great to extend usb charging cables, will not allow a hard drive to connect. 2 cables, both dont work. Wife is now happy having longer charging cables. back to square one.
customer_reviews.author: James Stallings

customer_reviews.title: 50% chance or working.
customer_reviews.text: This comes in a two pack. Luckily, considering one stopped working and gave an error recognizing all usb devices plugged into it in less than a week. Expecting a replacement after I call, but wondering if I should just return and get my money back and look elsewhere, so far that’s what I suggest to anyone seeing this unless you wanna roll the dice. The fact that it failed after a week instead of being defective on arrival is disconcerting to me and should be to a potential buyer as well. Poor quality/long term reliability is what I am seeing here.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good basic cables, caution about defects after two months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I connected two of these extension cables to my bedside computer, to operate external storage devices. After two months of use, I had to return one cable, after normal use, due to no connectivity! The warranty covered the replacement cable, which I'm grateful for. So this is a basic cable, but caution is advised, about possible defects that don't show up at the onset. Update and Caveat: these cables break easily, and could endanger one's computer. Amazon sent me a replacement pair, but alas, the replacement was also defective. One star.
customer_reviews.author: Mohabee Serrano

customer_reviews.title: Great cables, great price.
customer_reviews.text: I made up a couple of external hard disk drives with couple of extra drives I had sitting around and some new external housings, but I needed some long cables so I could get them to reach my computer from where I wanted to have them set. Amazon's brand of cables had the length I wanted and the best price. The cables are excellent quality and work well. I am pleased with their purchase and recommend them if you need more cables.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Yes - Amazon Basics USB 3.0 Extension Cable is great!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a USB cable purchased from a chain store. I was constantly getting a power surge message and it finally failed. When we use laptops on our laps, there is torque on any cable connected as the cable droops off our laps (duh). So the quality of the connectors really matters. This AmazonBasics USB 3.0 Extension Cable - A-Male to A-Female Adapter Cord- 9.8 Feet has very sturdy connectors at both ends. And the connection from the USB component to the cable is also sturdy. This is much better (and cost less) than my first cable. Thanks, Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: mch

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with my Samsung VR headset. Lots of static in the audio.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to extend my Samsung VR headset's cables but it did not work. It would connect but then there would be a lot of noise in the audio and eventually it would drop. Sometimes I'd have to plug the headset in 3 or 4 times just to get the system to recognize it while using this cable. I tried different USB 3.0 ports on my machine but they all performed the same. FWIW, my system is: * Samsung Odyssey+ HMD * Ryzen 7 3700x * ASRock motherboard with the X570 chipset * MSI nVidia RTX 2070 Super
customer_reviews.author: pseudosavant

customer_reviews.title: I bought two of these, no regrets
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly as expected, extends a USB 3.0 port outward 6 feet. The cables feel standard, no cheap materials here. As long as the cable is not subject to any stress, trauma, or kinking, it should last a while. I am not using it for charging purposes, so I cannot speak on behalf of that, though as long as it doesn't surpass the length required for an active USB 3.0 cable, it should be good enough. I recommend this product to extend your USB 3.0 port reach.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Zuniga

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little cable that makes life so much easier .
customer_reviews.text: Didn't think that I'd be writing reviews for a usb cable extender but here I am , Thank you COVID19 and stay at home lol . Anyway , I love this little wire , helps extend the USB connection from the back of my TV o where I can easily plug in a flash drive .This helps extend my TV's internal memory and I can watch all those home videos and pics from flash drive straight to my TV . A great little convenience item !
customer_reviews.author: dimensions

customer_reviews.title: A Bargain And They Work Just Fine
customer_reviews.text: I've got a bunch of these. Very simple and frequently useful cable that weirdly enough I can never find on store shelves. So far I've only used them to extend 2.0 devices like my mouse, keyboard, wacom tablet. But they work great and have a solid connection. They're not thin and flimsy wire so I'm not worried that extending the cable will effect the bandwidth in any significant way, unless maybe if you're trying to connect an external SSD 6+ ft from your computer. But why would you need to do that? This 2 pack is a bargain as well.
customer_reviews.author: Jendrasiak

customer_reviews.title: Female connector pins bend in
customer_reviews.text: The cable looked great, but the two horizontal pins on the female end of the connectors bend in very easily. I ran the cable under my rug so I can game my PC via my TV. After 11 months it stopped working ( may have accidentally placed an arm chair on the rug with the cables underneath). In other words, its not durable at all, and although my stepping on it played a role I bet, the connector pins are a real pain in the butt to unbend. I would not buy electronics from Amazon probably again.
customer_reviews.author: Gigadeath

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is durable
customer_reviews.text: I don't treat this cord with any special care and am often yanking it out of my PS4 as I throw my controller because I bought a game that was released too early and everything about it seems broken (the game, not the cord). This cord has held up very well and gives my controller another good 3 feet of distance extension on my charging cord for my controller. I've even stepped on the connector a few times and caught our cat playing with it and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Meyle

customer_reviews.title: Seem to be good Quality cables
customer_reviews.text: Seem to be good Quality cables. I have not ran any bandwidth test on them but overall they are great so far. The only downside to this cable is the size. Compared to it's competitors it's very large. Which also explains the durability of them. What can I say... they are USB extensions you know what you're wanting if you're looking at these. They are worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sullentrop

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product and affordable. I've bought several
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this USB extension. I have purchased SEVERAL of these. Be aware that these are USB 3.0 speed, so this is the best if your USB ports and devices are 3.0 speed. However if your ports or devices are only 2.0 speed, they will be compatible but it will not increase the speed, everything will still run at 2.0.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: What can I say. They work. Great price
customer_reviews.text: The worst thing about buying a cable is when you use it and it doesn't work. Then you get a spare one that is in the drawer and everything works fine. And use only realize that the cheap cable you bought is useless because there is an internal wire failure or connection. This is a great price. It allows an easy way to extend any USB cable. I would like to hardwire my printers as I think the connection is better and the transmission speed is faster. This allows me to extend my USB wiring to my computer without a problem. Great price and good quality
customer_reviews.author: HomerTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very inexpensive, but fast
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these to bring the USB3.0 ports on the back of my computer around to the front. I have used several different devices with this, and it is definitely faster than USB2.0. Because of the length, it isn't quite as fast as plugging the device directly into the port on the computer. I honestly can't figure out how they make any money selling them at the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Effective in helping the signal get through
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for when I travel for work for large conferences. I am usually sitting in the back of the room running the show and our speaker at the front has a slide advance clicker. We found that this really helped keep the connection between the laptop at the back of the room to the clicker open. With this we found that there was not as much of a delay when using the clicker. This is a must have in my travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Megan N.

customer_reviews.title: It will not charge devices connected to it
customer_reviews.text: Wanted an extension to facilitate charging my tablet. This cable will not allow devices to charge. I thought all USB cables would have the same capability, but neither of these will charge a phone or a tablet. Data transfer is fine, but charging is not available. Had I known, would not have purchased
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Got Two Bad Cords In A Row
customer_reviews.text: Hello! So I bought this cord to extend the reach from an USB port to my wireless phone charger. The first cord I recieved was broken and did not run any power through it. I complained and Amazon sent me a second one, free of charge, which was really nice of them! However, the second one is dead as well. I've tried plugging them into different USB ports that I -KNOW- work and still nothing. Everything I plug directly into the port works fine. Try to run it through the extender? Absolutely nothing. If it works for you, great! However, I was not impressed with this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Does the job at a low price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to extend the reach of an external CDROM drive that I need in the field. As most of you may not know, CDrom drives are all but gone on most notebooks. Most gaming rigs use downloaded files. I needed a CDrom drive for a customer that I needed to restore data. This system dos not have the drive. This cable helped me extend the USB connection. I highly recommend this to anyone who wants to extend a USB connection with a quality cable at a reasonable price. It just works.
customer_reviews.author: Duane G. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Disconnects frequently if plug not perfectly aligned with no sideways pressure.
customer_reviews.text: I use 2 of these to extend the range of my DSLR camera and my USB3 Astrophotography camera so that my telescope can sit a little way away from my laptop for astrophotography. The cable is sturdy, but may be too sturdy. These cables put pressure on the laptop's USB3 port if the cable is twisted even a tiny bit. The Operating System gives a cable disconnect error frequently if there is any pressure on the side or angled on the cable. They may be sturdy, they may be durable, but it doesn't matter if the OS keeps thinking you unplugged the cable.
customer_reviews.author: Robinson Cruise Oh

customer_reviews.title: so happy about this purchase
customer_reviews.text: such an easy way to charge my phone from anywhere in the house! And it does not change the quality or speed of charging like others have in the past. Very happy with this purchase overall💙 I bought one for me, and my husband ordered one for himself shortly after. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy for quick charging Samsung phones
customer_reviews.text: Unable to fast charge. 1st one didn't work on my phone for power or on my PC mouse. Requested a replacement which arrived very quickly only to have it not fast charge (or slow, it was the mode where it doesn't even charge if you're roaming with battery saver on). It did work with my mouse. But that's not what I needed it for. Not sure if I got a bad batch or what, but I can't recommend this for anything than a simple extension cord for a mouse or keyboard or printer. File transfer would probably be very slow. Samsung Galaxy s8 (usb-c) for reference with multiple cords tried.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C.

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with Seagate Backup Portable Drive
customer_reviews.text: These cables are nice and have gold ends - all pointing to quality. Unfortunately, I bought them to extend the very short USB 3.0 cable that came with my Seagate Backup Plus Portable Drive and it does not work for it. When I plug the drive directly into the computer using it's own cable, it works perfectly. When I plug the Seagate cable into the extension, I get numerous file read errors, which stop the file transfer process. I tried it several times with the same result. I returned them and Amazon gave me a prompt refund.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Guy

customer_reviews.title: High Quality / Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to connect an RTL-STR dongle to my computer's USB port and ensure I had some measure of filtering and shielding from external RF sources. This works fairly well, and reduced the amount of RF interference quite a bit. It is definitely a heavy-duty fabrication and will probably last a lifetime. Another aspect that I really like is the length, which makes positioning my receiver very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Tee

customer_reviews.title: Nice, thick cables and solid-feeling connectors
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed - not nearly enough ports on the computer and only one on the front, so I needed a hub connected to the back. Which, unfortunately, had an entirely too short cable. This seems to have solved my issues and I haven't had any sort of connectivity problems with it either. Nice, thick cables and solid-feeling connectors. (Though we'll have to see over time.)
customer_reviews.author: Lothus

customer_reviews.title: Niiiiiiiiiiiiice
customer_reviews.text: The cord is thicker than I thought but not too think so they will last. There is no lag when using them. Probably going to order another set just because they are so darn useful. Think about it, anything you use a USB for you can use these. I even wanted to see if it would work plugging my iPhone cord in it and if it would be the same charging time and work and it did.
customer_reviews.author: AlaskanLost

customer_reviews.title: It will give you issues!
customer_reviews.text: Whether it's extending a cable for your dash cam to extending a USB webcam, it will give you issues. It gave me false issues with my dash cam where the device will suddenly power down and power back up again. Also, my webcam started to not be detected by my computer UNLESS I get rid of the extension. Better yet, it doesn't help charge my device, if I need to have it on an extension USB.
customer_reviews.author: MRandomInterviews

customer_reviews.title: Stiff
customer_reviews.text: Decent cheap cable, but it's extremely stiff and keeps its shape so that it can be really hard to use. If it's going to be connected to anything that you're moving around or especially if your holding it, you probably want to buy a different cable as the stiffness can make the cable twist up, jump, or even disconnect. If you're going to hook up the cable leave it somewhere and never move it then it's probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: High Speed works, power not tested
customer_reviews.text: I get fast transfer speeds from these cables. They are a bit shorter than I expected but then Im not good at measuring distances. I use one for a laptop card reader to use with my PC and the other has a bluetooth dongle on the end and is lifted high in the air. Ive never plugged a phone in to charge it so I dont know how well they transfer power.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bludt

customer_reviews.title: 6ft version works perfectly on Oculus Rift Sensors or Headset!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few different USB 3.0 extension cables with the Oculus. None worked great. This Amazon Basics one works perfectly! I only needed one of the USB cables, but currently only comes in a 2 pack. No big deal, as the price is already really cheap for this high quality cable. I combined it with the 'AmazonBasics High-Speed Male to Female HDMI Extension Cable - 6 Feet' found here.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Paterson

customer_reviews.title: You will get I/O errors if too long (>3 ft)
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy these too long. They have I/O errors with usb self powered devices such as usb sticks, adapters, SD readers, etc. even external hard drive adapters with their own power. Try to stick to less than 3 ft with these extension thpes
customer_reviews.author: D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to add length to short cords
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as I bought some wireless phone chargers and the cords attached to them were only about a foot in length (or less!). I didn’t want to buy a whole new cord and just wanted something I could switch around if needed. This fit my exact needs, plus it was pretty inexpensive for 2-6 ft cords. They are perfect and they feel pretty rugged though I don’t think I’ll need to put them to the test on that front.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K.

customer_reviews.title: Must-by if you think the iPhone charging cable is too short
customer_reviews.text: This USB3.0 cable allows for iPhone charging/data transfer!!! Unlike some of the other 6ft lightening cables that stop working after a few weeks of use, this will always work even if apple changes the charging head in the future (unless USB4.0 comes out). The price is also fantastic for the length you are getting. I would just purchase the 6ft cable since it's only $1 difference from the 3ft one. Pros: Never have to leave your phone near the outlet to charge, 6ft should be plenty long to stretch to your couch/chair/bed. Allows for data transfer/charging of iPhones. Also works with car USB ports. Cons: None. Maybe allow for purchase in white? Gotta match the iPhone cable right...?
customer_reviews.author: Di W.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work with External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to extend my laptop closer to me, I hooked it up to a Sabrent 4 port usb 3.0 hub, and everything worked except one of my external hard drives. Not sure why. My other external drive works fine. When I changed back to just using the Sabrent, all the items worked. This was a 2 pack so I tried the other cable, same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ameraweazel2

customer_reviews.title: Get the correct length
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these in various sizes and I haven't had any issues at all with them. I have even traveled with a couple of them not covering the ends like I should and they haven't broken yet. They still work as good today as they did when I purchased them. This is the first time I have ordered the short 6' cable and I am happy with the quality and the value. It doesn't feel cheep like the price point would suggest.
customer_reviews.author: PhoenixZ

customer_reviews.title: 1st cable was defective, replacement works
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. Nice long length. Feels strong and sturdy. Edit: It was working great for the first few days, and then out of nowhere it just stopped working. I submitted a replacement request and will update my review after I test the replacement. Edit 2: The replacement has been working fine for the past 4 days. Hoping this one doesn’t stop working!
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: Extended range of USB headset
customer_reviews.text: I have a jabbra headset with a small USB dongle. When I used this extension, I can go throughout the entire hose when I'm on calls! I can even go upstairs and outside without losing the connection.
customer_reviews.author: BilliamIV

customer_reviews.title: One out of two worked
customer_reviews.text: I bough t a two pack of the 3.3 ft. USB 3.0 extension cables. I bought these cables to extend my keyboard cables (Corsair K70). The first cable I tried worked fine but the second one for my USB pass through caused my computer to not power off correctly. I was going to order a replacement for my power supply which is $125.00, then I remembered a someone telling me the cables on amazon were a gamble. So I removed the second USB cable connected to my USB pass through and problem went away.
customer_reviews.author: T. Truman

customer_reviews.title: Happy as can be and I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: So far; Excellent quality, nice sturdy and thick cables. Must have large gauge conductors to keep any loss to a minimum so I am happy as can be. This is for me again an excellent Amazon Basic product which turned out to be of a great quality for a more as fair price. So yes I can recommend this product without having to think twice about it. I am a very critical person and finding quality is a natural thing for me. I am bluntly honest and call / name it as things come, no sugar coating or nonsense. Two thumbs up Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: NAMOR

customer_reviews.title: Works sporadically
customer_reviews.text: I used this cable for a mouse, and sometimes it wouldn't work. Bad contacts, I suppose, although they seemed to fit fine. Perhaps my computer's USB ports are wearing out after 14 years, though it doesn't work in either of them, and all my other USB connectors still do. Amazon refunded my money; no problem except a little wasted time.
customer_reviews.author: Shagbark

customer_reviews.title: Used for hard to reach USB ports
customer_reviews.text: Our large den TV hangs on a bracket affixed above the fireplace mantle in our den. While the TV is held securely, there isn't much room for adult male hands to grope blindly trying to locate the available USB ports. So I bought these long extension cords so the wife could watch movies and shows stored on thumb drives. So far she is very happy, as am I.
customer_reviews.author: John B. Williams Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Extension for PS4 Platinum Headset bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Was experiencing tons of annoying static with my PS4 platinum headset and was cutting out often. This was the answer. Provides an extension for the PS4 to allow the dongle to be closer to myself when playing. This cut down any interference between the dongle and my headser. Very affordable fix instead of trying to get a more expensive headset. Highly recommended USB extension for any devices.
customer_reviews.author: Aku

customer_reviews.title: Works as a USB 3.0 estension cable
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I wanted to run my Microphone interface through a switched USB hub to the computer, but the hub's cable was only about 6 inches long. With these, I can relocate the switch to my desk and only power up the interface as I need to. The interface is USB 3.0, and works with these cables without an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great for PlayStation Classic!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these USB extenders to use with my PlayStation Classic. Overall these have been great, I was able to extend both the controller USB cord and the power USB cord with no issues or any noticeable button input lag during the games. I would definitely recommend these for any PlayStation Classic owners who would like longer cords.
customer_reviews.author: RobPlease

customer_reviews.title: Makes using the USB slot on my TV so much easier
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't need to be QUITE this long, but it makes watching MP4's(or playing ANY media files!) from a thumb drive so much easier. No more fiddling with a flashlight and hoping I don't drop the flash drive, either putting it in or getting it out. Practically a necessity if you have neuropathy in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Cholly

customer_reviews.title: Best USB extender on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: These things are insane. I think I've bought 9 cables of different lengths of Amazons brand and they're great. Super sturdy, thick, and I've used it for cellphones, game controllers, security cameras, and more. Still haven't gotten a bad cable, and they still carry the signal great across long distances. I know I'm going to buy a bunch more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Daaku026

customer_reviews.title: Don't use for USB 2.0 device charging
customer_reviews.text: Got this as an extension to charge my watch. Apparently USB 3 must be different in some manner than USB 2.0 because none of the USB 2.0 devices I wanted to charge would work when plugged in with this.
customer_reviews.author: SC.

customer_reviews.title: Fails all the time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to add an extension to my keyboard cable.. When I boot up the computer is mostly sees the keybord but after a short while I lose it.. I get an error message and the keybord doesn't work.. So I gave up and now have it plugged in direct and it works just fine..without this cable. Sometimes I could get it to work jiggling the connections but that's not working in my book.. The cable is heading to the recycle bin.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Shade

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Amazon Firestick
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am disappointed. I had my Firestick plugged into this for about a day when my Firestick began restarting continually. I assumed it was going dead till I read that Firesticks can be picky about power supplies. So I swapped out this cable for an actual extension cord, and it worked fine. I tried probably five different combinations of cables, but whenever this cable was in the chain, FIrestick does not work. Considering this is supposed to extend the capabilities of USB (providing power being one of the most basic) and is made/promoted by Amazon--the same company that makes my Firestick--I am let down.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rigney

customer_reviews.title: NOT USB 3.0
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this for use with my oculus quest headset. The USB 3.0 to USB C cable I used was tested and known to work with the headset; however, when the same cable was used with this extension, it would not be recognized as USB 3.0. The headset was recognized, but, in the Oculus application, it did not detect 3.0. I tested different ports and different computers with the same result. I suspect the cable is not actually suited for 3.0 connection.
customer_reviews.author: cmoscar

customer_reviews.title: VERY good quality, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: VERY thick cable, totally high quality. Used this as an extension for my dash cam's original USB cable so that I route the wire along the floor board and under the seat could plug into the cigarette outlet in the hatch of my car. No need to worry about shielding, this cable has got you covered! Be advised. as is pretty normal, theres a but of an exposed metal gap where part of the male USB is exposed when joined with the female. my remedy was just to cover that with some black electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with Oculus link
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the Oculus Link and they do not work. Won't recognize the connection as a 3.0 if both are used and only runs for about 2-20 seconds with one of them before freezing up. As far as everything else goes, however, the cords appear to be pretty decent. Durability seems good although they are a bit stiff so you wouldn't want to bend them a lot, and the connection isn't super tight although it held on strong enough to stay connected while they were dangling from my headset. As for the Oculus I don't know if it's just the cables or if it's the headset. Either way for me they didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: John Michel

customer_reviews.title: Did not work to visit
customer_reviews.text: Bought these cables for charging phone on other side of the bed. Nether one worked. Charge cords work off the USB ports on the power strip and the normal 110v adapters. But when cord plugged into usb extension no power to devise. Weird. Will order some longer charge cords.
customer_reviews.author: Wondering

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!  Super fast, high quality, it just works!
customer_reviews.text: Another surprisingly good product for a ridiculously low price. I needed this for a USB wireless networking thumbstick that needed to be plugged directly into a USB port (if I tried it in a hub, it would keep freezing up). It works perfectly in this, achieving 144 Mbps steady. I also tried an external hard drive to test speed, and it was just as fast as plugging it directly into the USB 3.0 port. It is super sturdy, exactly the length specified, and packaged well. I've gotten to the point that I seek out Amazonbasics products because of the quality they have demonstrated, and I have yet to regret it.
customer_reviews.author: SlushierCashewTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Failed just stitting there
customer_reviews.text: This was in use, connecting a USB2 serial port to a monitoring PC at a remote location. It just failed, no movement, no hot-plugging, just failed. Brought it in to the office and plugged into my system and it immediately caused my system to power-off, like it shorted out the power supply. I have USB2 extensions that are probably close to 20 years old that still work. I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Insufficient Funds

customer_reviews.title: Is it thick enough?
customer_reviews.text: Is it thick enough? I thought this was a coaxial cable when I first got it. It’s very long and useful but it doesn’t bend easily because of how thick it is which makes it heavy. I was using it as a usb extender for my gaming headphones and the cord adds some weight to my headphones which makes it a bit uncomfortable. If you don’t mind the thickness and weight of it or that doesnt apply to what you’re planning on using it then it’s a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work to extend my webcam. The software works ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work to extend my webcam. The software works if I plug the camera directly, but if I plug it with the cable it doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar L.

customer_reviews.title: Failed 3 years to the date
customer_reviews.text: Works for a while, appears to be a solidly built cable, but didn't work for data transfer after 3 years of use even though nothing appeared to be wrong with the cable and no visible damage anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Did not work at all!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these back in February but just now attempted to use them. They did not work at all! I normally get good results from Amazon Basics equipment; however, these were a complete disappointment. I guess it is too late to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Dale K.

customer_reviews.title: It's a solid USB 3.0 extension cable
customer_reviews.text: I use this to plug a small USB DAC (like a Dragonfly Red, but not that specifically) into a couple of awkwardly-located PCs so I can listen to music on headphones. It doesn't really need to be USB 3.0, but it does need to work without dropping packets. It does. Cable construction is sturdy and I expect this to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: David M Hungerford III

customer_reviews.title: Does the job; good value
customer_reviews.text: Not much to be said. I bought 4 of these for my engineering workstation; peripheral USB cables are often too short and I needed at least 7 ft. The cable and the connectors are solid. Works as expected. The shielding is rather thick for USB, but then again, these will probably outlast whatever they're being used to connect for. Very good value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mingus

customer_reviews.title: NOT IMPRESSED AMAZON!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bad Connection Slow Charge tried a far range of cords and power strips and outlets from wall.Not Impressed Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: BRiZaR

customer_reviews.title: Worked Exactly As Needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought both of these as USB extenders for two gaming headsets. These cords worked perfectly and did exactly that I needed then to. The headsets have to be plugged into the controller on the PS4 which doesn't leave enough room to plug the USB into the PS4 for the LEDs to work. It wasn't a deal-breaker but having these cords makes the USB cord long enough to be plugged into the PS4 as well. The 6 foot length leaves plenty of slack as well so these cords couldn't have worked any better!
customer_reviews.author: Colton Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: When you need to extend you USB 3.0 connection, this is it. But I only needed 1 cable, not two. Anyhow, someday I may need a second one and will have it. Very nice construction. From time to time (valid for any cable connector), clean the contacts with a dab of alcohol, just to be sure. If needed will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Shields at least connected on both ends
customer_reviews.text: First and foremost, the shield is connected on both ends, so I assume that the cable will perform well! I have purchased other USB3 extension cables and they caused many issues with the PC, such as loss of the USB headphones that connected with it via a poor (improperly shielded) cable. Every time someone touched my cubicle wall, I lost my headphones, and even had to reboot sometimes!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 weeks and not working
customer_reviews.text: The cord no longer works after just 2 weeks of use. I have this extension powering a VERY small LED light which is only powered on during working hours, so about 40 hours a week or less. I have had the LED light plugged in using this extension for around 2 weeks and one day it just did not come on. I have tried this extension on different cords and outlets and it no longer works
customer_reviews.author: OCD-one

customer_reviews.title: Useful little extension chord.
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. We have many "inconvenient" power plugs that are a little too far away to comfortably use when you want to charge your phone but also have access to it.The connector piece has some weight to it, so keep that in mind, but otherwise it does exactly as I expected it to.
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: Quality usb extension
customer_reviews.text: I needed to extend my webcam to turn it into a ceiling view. This cable was perfect. The cable is nice and thick and adds significant length to my camera. Recommend if you need a usb extension. Just make sure whatever you are plugging supports the length of itself and a cable
customer_reviews.author: CoolRunninJA

customer_reviews.title: Zero power going through from 4 separate cables
customer_reviews.text: Want to extend my USB type c cable longer to charge my phone. Also wanted to extend the cable of my keyboard, and desktop DAC/Amp. Wtf are these even for if they can't even draw power? No power? No charging? No power? No data transfer. What good are these crap cables for? I have a very old Apple branded USB extension cable that works unlike these 4 separate useless cables.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Val

customer_reviews.title: Good for charging
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a few days but it's awesome. I'm using it to connect and charge my phone. I'm connecting the original type c cable that came with the phone to the 10 ft extender and it charges fast. The cable is thick and sturdy, I like when the cables don't feel flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: kmlopez85

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics USB 3.0 Extension Cable - A-Male to A-Female Extender Cord - 3 .3 Feet (2 Pack)
product_meta.description: Size:3.3 Feet/2-Pack| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingAn Amazon Brand.
feature_bullets: Two 3.3-foot-long USB 3.0 A-Male to A-Female high-speed extension cables
Extends your USB connection to your computer by 3.3 feet; for use with printers, cameras, mice, keyboards and other USB computer peripherals
Constructed with corrosion-resistant, gold-plated connectors for optimal signal clarity and shielding to minimize interference
Features shielding that provides protection against noise from electromagnetic and radio-frequency signals, keeping your signal clear with less loss of bandwidth for higher performance
USB 3.0 uses less power, but has increased power output - up to 4.8 Gbit/s. Compared with the USB 2.0 transmission speed, USB 3.0 is 10 times faster

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars16,095 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
